title: Kingman Reef
summary: Kingman Reef /ˈkɪŋmən/ is a largely submerged, uninhabited, triangle-shaped reef, 9.0 nmi (20 km) east-west and 4.5 nmi (8 km) north-south,[2] in the North Pacific Ocean, roughly halfway between the Hawaiian Islands and American Samoa.[3][4] It has an area of 3 hectares (0.03 km2) and is one of the unincorporated territories of the United States[5] in Oceania.[5]
